intro: Cleistesiopsis bifaria, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cleistesiopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Cleistesiopsis bifaria is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
